s.text: Then he heard her step through the forest, the sound Of the steps preceding her through the leaves Like the calling card of a doe approaching the water, Trying her footing across newly covered ground.

Backpacker, he thought, and put away his bottle, Not wanting it a stranger's first sight of him, Cheered it might be someone who liked a line of chatter, He, not having spoken to anything but a worm All day in the forest instead of at work.
